intro: Tithymalus oblongifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves that are usually dark green and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tithymalus oblongifolius is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
